name: Merlin Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 10 glorious days here and were not dissappointed with our choice but overwhelmed by its beauty and the atmosphere of the merlin. We have just returned and boy did we not want to leave and already planning our next holiday there. Stayed in a deluxe room well furnished and very clean on fourth floor overlooking the beach and pool, the pools are to die for and my husband was quite shocked as I am a shopping fanatic and I never wanted to leave the hotel as it was so relaxing. The staff was ever so friendly and went out of there way for you, ate alot at the the resort and didn't find prices to be too bad and the food was outstanding, the thai resturant there has the best thai we have tasted. Had a massage at the hotel spa (for 2 massages was about $100)was a relaxing surrounding which I think thats what your paying for but there are so many massage places around in patong you can't go wrong. Must say the massage girls down on the beach at the resort do an excellent job had a massage, manicure, pedficure and hair extensions at all very affordable prices 300 baht for an hour massage. As metioned before the pools are just brilliant and the pool bar is great happy hour was on tuesdays at the pool bar and the looby lounge with live entertainment every night has happy hour 6pm to 8pm. Had our wedding anniversary over there and the staff were excellent and with my husband organised a huge bunch of flowers to be in my room when I got back from elephant trekking with Richard.
reviews.title: merlin beach was spectacalur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being that little out of town was perfect as you were away from all the noise, hustle and bustle, some funky smells and the tailors who harrassed you all down beach rd. And 200 baht for a tuk tuk is not much here and there to town plus there is the shuttle bus/truck which takes you in for free.
reviews.title: A Great Resort

reviews.text: Overall this hotel will leave beautiful memories for us especially lazing around the pool with a cocktail in hand, being waited on hand and foot and would recommend this hotel too anyone who wants everything at their doorstep and stay in a magnicifient resort.
reviews.title: Nice hotel not great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a wonderful 8 night stay at Merlin Beach followed by 5 nights at Khao Lak Merlin. We had a very good deal, where we got 5 nights free at Khao Lak if we stayed 5 or more at the Merlin Beach. We loved both of them, although they offer very different experiences, as Khao Lak is still very quiet and not recovered from the tsunami as yet. We had a deluxe room overlooking pool 2. Room was not huge, but spacious enough with king size bed. The only disappointment with the room was the shower was not as clean as it should have been. We asked for them to clean the shower door again, it was little better but still quite grotty. The rest of the bathroom was clean though. Breakfast was always great, but the staff were a little slow at times. We ate a few times at the hotel restaurants but were not that impressed with the food, especially the buffet. However, these were the only downsides. The pools were wonderful. We found the shuttle times into Patong okay, but we also hired a motorbike from across the road to get around. We didn't want to be in the hustle of Patong all the time anyway. The beach at the hotel was not great, as stated many times, but lovely to catch the sea breeze. The beach across the road was beautiful, and took a couple of minutes to walk to. We enjoyed many happy hours at the pool bar and lobby bar, and although the band were not that great, we still enjoyed them, they were quite entertaining anyway. We were there from mid to late August and were expecting it to rain quite a bit, but luckily for us we had only 3 days of rain in 14. Anyone interested in also going to Khao Lak Merlin, resort was on a beautiful beach, with lots of pools. The rooms there are more Thai influenced, lots of atmosphere, and much larger. But be prepared for a very quiet place, only one restaurant open at the moment, but the food there was great, much better than Merlin Beach. Staff were awesome. Also about 10 mins into town, but not much there, still rebuilding.
reviews.title: pool access rooms great

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the Merlin for 10 days and we were disappointed after all of the reviews that we read. Firstly is a long way from Patong or anything else for that matter. You would not walk into Patong in a hurry so this means the free shuttle bus that runs rarely or a taxi for 200 baht is your options. Then for getting back a Tuk Tuk will cost 150 baht. So if you are not using the shuttle then this will be an expensive choice. Patong anyway is not that nice of a place but at least other resorts like the Amari Coral Resort are walking distance (5 mins).
reviews.title: Wonderful end to a holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for 6 nights for our honeymoon after staying 5 nights already at Phi Phi Island. We weren't really sure what it was going to be like because my parents were meant to stay here the year prior when it was destroyed by the tsunami but they never did.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay

reviews.text: We were so impressed upon entering!
reviews.title: a lovely lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one of the rooms where you can swim straight off your balcony! We booked this room straight off the net (not on a last minute deal) and saved quite a bit compared to what the travel agent was quoting us. The bed was covered in flowers, petals and in the bath. The room was a very generous size with a queen bed and all the mod cons. You could even open the shutters that were on the bathroom wall and see the pool through the room.
reviews.title: Not convinced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools were amazing! 3 different pools that everyone can access. Kids section was great too. Swim up bar was a lovely treat where you could play jenga and order food whilst sitting in the water. The buffet breakfasts were to die for. Many different foods for all nationalities. They were quite busy between 8-9 though.
reviews.title: Everything you could wish for

reviews.text: There was a 3 person band each night in the cocktail bar which were brilliant, enjoyed with 2-4-1 cocktails.
reviews.title: A Fabulous Place To Stay

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms and safe and advantage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the MERLIN BEACH RESORT at the end of June/begining of July 2006 for 11nights. After 3 nights in Bangkok I was looking forward to some relaxation, this resort didn't disappoint. This was 1 of the nicest hotels I have stayed in, everything was great! On our 1st night was decided to stay at the hotel and eat, it cost us about £17 for 2 of us which we didn't think was that bad, that was until we went into Patong. There, we were having a meal for 2 plus beers for about £3.50 (Restaurant 4 and Restaurant 6) or we'd go to the Savoey Fish Restaraunt and have a starters, lobster or red snapper, rice and drinks for about £15.
reviews.title: Great place but a little out of the way

likes.liked: — THE POOLS ARE OUT OF THIS WORLD!
likes.disliked: — A LITTLE OUT OF THE WAY

reviews.title: wicked Thai Restaurant
reviews.text: As most of the other reviews state, the buses run at unsuitable times but I think that was to encourage people to eat at the hotel. We actually found it cheaper to get a Tuk Tuk into Patong (200 Baht-no bartering) and a Tuk Tuk back (150 Baht-they'll say 200 but just say no).

reviews.title: Well worth it
reviews.text: The breakfast here was the perfect start to the day, there was something for everyone. They start serving at around 6am and don't finish until 10.30am so it gives plenty of time. We found that we wouldn't want anything to eat at lunchtime as the breakfast was so filling.
As for trips, we went to the Phi Phi Islands and elephant treking and loved both. Already looking forward to going back next year as there is still things we want to see and do.
reviews.title: The Best Resort in Phuket by far...

reviews.text: The only dowside to the hotel is that its a little out of the way although this can also be a good thing. We never had any trouble getting back, even at 3am! We went into Patong every night as we found the hotel a little expensive, a beer here would cost 150 Baht plus VAT and service charge, in Patong, the prices ranged from 40 Baht-100 Baht. You can get hassled a little in Patong for suits, bags, shoes, watches etc, just be firm or, when asked if we wanted a suit just say you are going home the next day, they can't get the suits made up in time!
reviews.title: Great resort
Loved it, but be cautious
reviews.text: Yes, all the raves about this great hotel is true. The breakfast was the best that we had at any of the hotels, and during this holiday we stayed at four. The food was fresh and the dishes, breads changed EVERY day, which was wonderful. We had rooms overlooking the street which I liked better than pool access because I could watch the vibe and buzz of the street and the beauty of the bush clad hills. We had a superior room and it was lovely, with a/c that WORKED, lovely decor and a good shower. The staff were industrious, smiling and very lovely, and gorgeously attired. However, there was a fly in the ointment - when we left the room for the final time to check out, between the time it took for us to go down in the elevator to the checkout desk, we were presented with a minbar bill for things we didn't consume! It took five minutes for someone, presumably the staff, to have a good feed on us! It really annoyed me, but we paid because the airport shuttle was waiting. Also, my friend had $70.00 (Aus) stolen out of her bag in a locked room, but the thieves left a fortune in New Zealand money in the same pocket. Hahaha!

Despite these minor hiccups, I would stay again because I really enjoyed this hotel. Don't book your trips to safari and islands with the hotel. Go down to the local bars and ask around, they will give you good pointers to book your trips for half the price.
reviews.title: Too good to be true
Perfect..but there's a catch!
reviews.text: We stayed here about four years ago, when the hotel was 11 months old. Rather silly writing a review now, but didn't know this site existed. I agree with all the other travellers with their rave reviews and are reallypleased to see that their standards have not changed.

The only downside to staying at this resort, is that we have found it hard to find hotels for our annual overseas holidays that can live up to this amazing standard. Once you have been there, you will never want to go anywhere else!
reviews.title: Great for couples, not for singles

reviews.text: Hi, I user tripadvisor to find this resort and after staying here the 1st thing I thought of was to confirm all the excellent stories about this place. It is amazing. But like usual I never got around to writing the review. Until now, a few months later when we have receieved a call from our credit card company.
reviews.title: Merlin Beach - Stunning

description: Merlin Beach Resort is a deluxe and luxurious hotel, situated on its own secluded Tri-Trang Beach (3 km. from Patong Beach). Low-rise buildings sitting along the private beach amongst 12 acres of swaying coconut palms and tropical garden.
